info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued October 6 at 8:42PM AKDT until October 9 at 7:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks AK
info.description:
* WHAT...Water levels rising 4 to 6 feet above the normal high tide line in Nome, 6 to 8 feet in Golovin.
* WHERE...Southern Seward Peninsula Coast.
* WHEN...From 8 AM Tuesday to 7 AM AKDT Thursday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Water levels up to 6 feet above the normal high tide line may put waves over the Nome-Council Road between mile 23 and 24. The road may flood or wash it out, but usually that happens with higher water levels. The Belmont Point Residential area in Nome will begin to flood once water levels reach 5 to 6 feet. West Beach of Nome will see coastal flooding when the heights reach 6 feet. In Golovin, coastal flooding may affect many residences, the school, power plant, tank farm, store and clinic. The highest water levels will be over the course of several high tides ranging from Wednesday morning through Thursday morning. Winds will be from the west- southwest throughout the event.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.

parameter.value: COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM TUESDAY TO 7 AM AKDT THURSDAY
